item.title: Fly tipping going on for months in Sudrey Street, 24th February
item.description:
The issue is located at approximately 11 Surrey Street, with coordinates 51.5011440, -0.0980398. Large quantities of black bin bags are repeatedly being dumped outside the rear entrance of the building rather than being stored in appropriate waste containers. The bags are left directly on the pavement and roadside. Many of the bags have split open, leaving food and household waste exposed. This is creating unsanitary conditions and poses a clear risk of attracting pests such as rats and flies, which is a recognised public health concern according to environmental health guidance. This is not an isolated incident. The dumping has been ongoing for months and the waste often remains for long periods without proper removal. I have attached photographs showing the scale and repeated nature of the issue. I would be grateful if this could be investigated as ongoing fly tipping and that appropriate enforcement action is taken against those responsible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sudrey Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Square at junction of priory park road and Tennyson road, 24th February
item.description:
Plaster board pieces dumped in square. Put together at edge for ease of collection. There is also a large tree trunk which has been there first r a week .. can't see where it has come from so maybe ripped off and dumped here but if that can be collected for free waste too, that would be useful.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tennyson Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Burnt wood with exposed nails creating an injury risk - public pavement obstruction, 24th February
item.description:
This rubbish was dumped outside my home on Saturday 21st of February by two men that I have video evidence of. It is on the pavement creating an obstruction and consists of burnt wood with nails sticking out which could easily cause an injury to people walking past.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 32, Elizabeth Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
